</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">On Friday, tornadoes struck the southern part of the State of Indiana. Counties known to have sustained damage include:Clark, Jefferson, Posey, Ripley, Warrick, Washington and Wayne. Spencer County is also reported to have sustained minor damage.  The hardest hit counties are reported to be Jefferson, Scott, Ripley and Washington Counties.The full extent of damage sustained in these counties is still unknown. Damage assessments are beginning. It will be a few days before damage estimates can be quantified.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Indiana Gov. Mitch Daniels spent much of today touring storm damaged communities in Southern Indiana.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">The Indiana National Guard, State of Indiana, and Marion County have deployed teams to respond to the event. Federal officials are en route to the State EOC.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">NEW INFORMATION</span></strong></p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Henryville Water Supply:</strong>  Water has been partially restored to the town of Henryville. Residents are advised they are under a DO NOT CONSUME warning.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Disaster Mental Health Teams:</strong>  Three teams from Indiana Division of Mental Health and Addictions have been deployed to Washington, Clark and Ripley counties to provide assistance to those impacted by the storms.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Toll-Free Crisis Counseling Line:</strong>  The Indiana Family and Social Services Administration (FSSA) has established a toll free hotline to provide mental health services for those affected by the storm:  1-866 679 4631. Individuals can receive counseling by phone or referrals for services.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> </p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Road Closures:</strong></p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">·         Ind. 160 East-bound (Clark Co) from West of Henryville at I-65</p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">·         U.S. 31 from S.R. 356 (Scott Co.) to S.R. 403 (Clark Co)</p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">·         U.S. 50 (Jennings Co) from U.S. 421 to North Vernon</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">For information on road closures, visit the Indiana Travel Conditions site, which can be found at <a href="http://indot.carsprogram.org/" target="_blank">http://indot.carsprogram.org</a>or by calling (800) 261-ROAD (7623)</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>New Shelter Opened: </strong> A new Red Cross shelterhas been opened at:</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Chelsea Church of God  <em>**Opened Saturday***</em></p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">6231 S. Ind. 62</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Lexington, IN 47138</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Power Outages:</strong> 726 customers without power</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Indiana Task Force 1: </strong> Indiana Task Force 1 team members are completing search and rescue activities on Saturday, March 3, and will be returning home after finalizing operations.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Volunteers: </strong> Individuals or groups who want to volunteer in storm-affected areas should contact Indiana Volunteers Active in Disasters, online at:  <a href="http://www.invoad.org">www.invoad.org</a> . Well-meaning individuals who show up to help without prior contact or coordination with disaster management personnel in southern Indiana can further complicate or even hinder response and recovery operations already underway.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Storm Damage Reports: </strong> Hoosiers, who sustained damage caused by severe weather that began Thursday, March 1, are being asked to report damage online by visiting <a href="http://www.in.gov/dhs">www.in.gov/dhs</a>and clicking on “<a href="https://eoc.in.gov/eoc7/idhs-apps/damage-assessment/">Citizen Damage Reports for March Severe Weather</a>” in the middle of the page under “Topics of the Day.” This is NOT an application for any assistance program, but a way to help local emergency managers to assess storm damage progress.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> </p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Open Shelters List:</strong></p><p style="margin-left:.5in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Charlestown High School</p><p style="margin-left:.5in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">1 Pirate Place</p><p style="margin-left:.5in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Charlestown, IN 47111</p><p style="margin-left:.5in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> </p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">South Ripley Elementary School</p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">1568 S. Benham Road</p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Versailles, IN 47042</p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> </p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">American Legion</p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">209 S. Main St</p><p style="margin-left:1.0in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Salem, IN 47167</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> </p><p style="margin-left:.5in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Chelsea Church of God  <em>**</em></p><p style="margin-left:.5in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">6231 S. State Road 62</p><p style="margin-left:.5in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Lexington, IN 47138</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Utilities:</strong> Due to many gas leaks, all natural gas services have been turned off in Henryville.</p>

</div></div><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Public Health:</strong> a tetanus clinic is being set up for Washington County residents ONLY at Pekin United Methodist Church in Pekin at 244 South Shorts Corner Rd.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>There are 14 confirmed fatalities:</strong></p><p style="margin-left:.5in;" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Jefferson County, 4 </p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Scott County, 3  </p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Ripley County, 2</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Washington County, 4</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Clark County, 1</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>Injuries: </strong> While significant numbers of injuries are being reported, there are no reports of local medical facilities being overwhelmed. </p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">RESPONSE EFFORTS</span></strong></p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong>State Emergency Operations Center</strong>:</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"> Under the leadership of the Indiana Department of Homeland Security (IDHS), the Indiana Emergency Operations Center (EOC) has increased staffing and will remain activated 24 hours a day to monitor conditions and provide resource support to county emergency agencies in areas affected by this afternoon’s severe storms and tornado activity.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd"><strong><span style="text-decoration: underline">PUBLIC ADVISORIES</span></strong></p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Anyone uncertain about the safety of residents in affected areas should visit <a href="http://www.redcross.org/" target="_blank">www.redcross.org</a>and click on “List Yourself or Search Registrants” to register or see if their loved one has checked in.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Tornado survivors and concerned citizens can call 2-1-1 (or 317.926.4357) for help and information regarding the recent severe weather event.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Hoosiers in the affected areas are asked to pay attention to and follow the directions of all local law enforcement and public safety officials. Hoosiers NOT in affected areas already are asked to refrain from traveling to affected areas.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">The single best way to help disaster survivors in southeastern Indiana is with a cash donation to a legitimate relief agency, such as the American Red Cross, operating in the area.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">People can help those affected by disasters like the Midwest tornadoes and storms, as well as countless crises at home and around the world, by making a donation to support American Red Cross Disaster Relief. Consider making a donation today by visiting <a href="http://www.redcross.org/" target="_blank">www.redcross.org</a>, calling 1-800-RED CROSS (1-800-733-2767) or texting the word REDCROSS to 90999 to make a $10 donation. Contributions may also be sent to someone’s local Red Cross chapter or to the American Red Cross, P.O. Box 37243, Washington, DC 20013. Contributions enable the Red Cross to prepare for and provide shelter, food, emotional support and other assistance in response to disasters.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Other sites to make monetary donations include: <a href="http://www.invoad.com/">www.invoad.com</a>; <a href="http://www.aidmatrixnetwork.org/fema/states.aspx?ST=Indiana">www.aidmatrixnetwork.org/fema/states.aspx?ST=Indiana</a>; and <a href="http://www.fema.gov/donations" target="_blank">www.fema.gov/donations</a> .</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">For more information about actions before, during and after severe weather and tornados, visit <a href="http://www.getprepared.in.gov/" target="_blank">GetPrepared.in.gov</a>.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Follow IDHS on Facebook and on Twitter at <a href="http://www.twitter.com/IDHS" target="_blank">www.twitter.com/IDHS</a> to stay informed about this developing situation.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Text “follow IDHS” to 40404 to receive updates from IDHS even if you do not have a twitter account.</p>

<div class="row">
<div class="col-md-12"><div class="tncms-region " id="tncms-region-option-rail-top-two"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1133989"><section class="block emphasis-h3 " id="block-1133989">
<div class="clearfix">
<div class="block-title title-1133989 ">
<div class="block-title-inner">
<h3>
                
                Online Poll
                
            </h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="poll-panel panel">
<div class="panel-body">
<h4 class="">
<a href="/opinion/poll-should-clark-and-floyd-county-school-districts-ditch-the/poll_8a5dc4ba-d6ce-11e7-b276-cba85abe572f.html">
        

        
        POLL: Should Clark and Floyd County school districts ditch the year-round academic calendar?</a></h4>
<div class="poll-content" id="poll-8a5dc4ba-d6ce-11e7-b276-cba85abe572f-1133989">
<div class="loading-poll hide-onload text-center"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-2x fa-spin"></i></div>
<div class="show-onload">
<p>West Clark Community Schools has voted to move forward with a more traditional school calendar after six years of a year-round school schedule. Greater Clark is expected to do the same, and Clarksville Community and New Albany-Floyd County schools are considering making the move. A more traditional school calendar would mean students would start school the second week of August (instead of in July), have one week off for fall and spring breaks (instead of two), and dismiss for summer break before the Memorial Day holiday.</p>
<div class="hide-onload" id="poll-8a5dc4ba-d6ce-11e7-b276-cba85abe572f-1133989-your-vote-container">
<strong>You voted:</strong> <div id="poll-8a5dc4ba-d6ce-11e7-b276-cba85abe572f-1133989-your-vote"></div>
</div>
<div id="poll-8a5dc4ba-d6ce-11e7-b276-cba85abe572f-1133989-results" style="display: none;"></div>
<div id="poll-8a5dc4ba-d6ce-11e7-b276-cba85abe572f-1133989-container">
<form action="/opinion/poll-should-clark-and-floyd-county-school-districts-ditch-the/poll_8a5dc4ba-d6ce-11e7-b276-cba85abe572f.html" id="poll-8a5dc4ba-d6ce-11e7-b276-cba85abe572f-1133989-form" method="post" role="form">
<div class="radio">
<label>
<input name="answer" title="Yes. Year-round was supposed to mean remediation time for students who have fallen behind, but that hasn't happened." type="radio" value="C7C79760-6300-0001-2D3F1D00AC80111B"/> Yes. Year-round was supposed to mean remediation time for students who have fallen behind, but that hasn't happened.
                                </label>
</div>
<div class="radio">
<label>
<input name="answer" title="No. The longer fall and spring breaks are perfect, and there's just enough of a summer break." type="radio" value="C7C79760-7D20-0001-FDBAEB0015271662"/> No. The longer fall and spring breaks are perfect, and there's just enough of a summer break.
                                </label>
</div>
<div class="radio">
<label>
<input name="answer" title="I'm indifferent, so long as all local school districts are on the same academic calendar." type="radio" value="C7C79760-9040-0001-FA30ABE0D130C610"/> I'm indifferent, so long as all local school districts are on the same academic calendar.
                                </label>
</div>
<button class="btn btn-success" type="submit">Vote</button>
<button class="btn btn-default" id="poll-8a5dc4ba-d6ce-11e7-b276-cba85abe572f-1133989-get-results">View Results</button>
</form>
</div>

<div class="asset-side-sticky" id="sticky-right-rail"><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-global-side-sticky"></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-asset_side_sticky"></div></div><script>
        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

Phil Scott was recently on Vermont Public Radio discussing the socalled crisis in education in Vermont. Like many advocates for school closures, his idea of crisis is rooted in<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/manufactured-school-crisis/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/blood-marathon-is-on-the-way/">Blood marathon is on the way</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 6, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">The 2017 Gift-of-Life Marathon blood drive is almost here and once again we are reaching out to the people of greater Rutland asking that they share their good health with<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/blood-marathon-is-on-the-way/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/devos-is-clear-wrong-choice/">DeVos is clear wrong ‘choice’</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 5, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">From the announcement of her appointment as U.S. secretary of education through Senate confirmation hearings that were often embarrassing, Betsy DeVos was ardently opposed by a wide range of people<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/devos-is-clear-wrong-choice/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/the-act-46-shell-game/">The Act 46 shell game</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 5, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">It should surprise no one, least of all our legislators, that we face an expected 8-cent increase in the education tax rate in the coming year. Congratulations, Matt. Expressing shame and regret over past immoral actions means that you still possess a human conscience. Too bad<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/smellier-by-the-day/">...</a></p></div></div></div><div class="oht-widget oht-widget--articles" id="oht_articles_widget-16"><h2 class="widget-title"><a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/category/opinion/commentary/">Commentary</a></h2><div class="fat-stacks oht-article-widget__content oht-5-count"><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/why-young-people-hate-capitalism/">Why young people hate capitalism</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 6, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">On a Friday night last month, I moderated a debate in Manhattan about whether we should scrap capitalism. It was organized by the socialist magazine Jacobin; defending capitalism were editors<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/why-young-people-hate-capitalism/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/the-ghost-of-steve-bannon/">The ghost of Steve Bannon</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 5, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">Steve Bannon may no longer be physically in the White House, but his spirit lingers there as the guide of the Donald Trump administration and the soul at the core<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/the-ghost-of-steve-bannon/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/what-i-learned-at-high-school/">What I learned at high school</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 2, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">Last year, more than 60,000 people died from opioid overdoses in the United States. That’s more Americans dying in one year than during the entire 19 years of the Vietnam<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/what-i-learned-at-high-school/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/fight-opioid-crisis-at-home/">Fight opioid crisis at home</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 2, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">Ninety-one Americans die every day from opioid overdose. Since 1999, the number of opioid<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/fight-opioid-crisis-at-home/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/climate-policy-innovation/">Climate policy innovation</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 2, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">Recent oil spills, short-sighted decisions and global climate talks highlight clearly that we still have a long way to go to meet our climate-change goals. Allowed file types: %s","gd_allowed_img_types":"jpg,jpeg,jpe,gif,png","geodir_txt_form_wait":"Wait...","geodir_txt_form_searching":"Searching...","fa_rating":"","reviewrating":"","multirating":"","geodir_map_name":"auto","osmStart":"Start","osmVia":"Via {viaNumber}","osmEnd":"Enter Your Location","ga_delete_check":"Do you wish to Deauthorize and break Analytics?","geoMyLocation":"My Location","geoErrUNKNOWN_ERROR":"Unable to find your location","geoErrPERMISSION_DENINED":"Permission denied in finding your location","geoErrPOSITION_UNAVAILABLE":"Your location is currently unknown","geoErrBREAK":"Attempt to find location took too long","geoErrDEFAULT":"Location detection not supported in browser","geodir_marker_cluster_size":"60","geodir_marker_cluster_zoom":"15","imagePath":"https:\/\/d2y8psjfi06mva.cloudfront.net\/geodir_marker_cluster\/images\/m"};</script> <script type="text/javascript">
        var default_location = 'Rutland';
        var latlng;
        var address;
        var dist = 0;
        var Sgeocoder = (typeof google!=='undefined' && typeof google.maps!=='undefined') ? new google.maps.Geocoder() : {};

		function geodir_setup_submit_search() {
            jQuery('.geodir_submit_search').unbind('click');// unbind any other click events
			jQuery('.geodir_submit_search').click(function(e) {

                e.preventDefault();

				var s = ' ';
				var $form = jQuery(this).closest('form');

				if (jQuery("#sdist input[type='radio']:checked").length != 0) dist = jQuery("#sdist input[type='radio']:checked").val();
				if (jQuery('.search_text', $form).val() == '' || jQuery('.search_text', $form).val() == 'Search for') jQuery('.search_text', $form).val(s);
				
				// Disable location based search for disabled location post type.
				if (jQuery('.search_by_post', $form).val() != '' && typeof gd_cpt_no_location == 'function') {
					if (gd_cpt_no_location(jQuery('.search_by_post', $form).val())) {
						jQuery('.snear', $form).remove();
						jQuery('.sgeo_lat', $form).remove();
						jQuery('.sgeo_lon', $form).remove();
						jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]', $form).remove();
						jQuery($form).submit();
						return;
					}
				}
				
				if (dist > 0 || (jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]').val() == 'nearest' || jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]', $form).val() == 'farthest') || (jQuery(".snear", $form).val() != '' && jQuery(".snear", $form).val() != 'Near')) {
					geodir_setsearch($form);
				} else {
					jQuery(".snear", $form).val('');
					jQuery($form).submit();
				}
			});
		}

        jQuery(document).ready(function() {
            geodir_setup_submit_search();
            //setup advanced search form on form ajax load
            jQuery("body").on("geodir_setup_search_form", function(){
                geodir_setup_submit_search();
            });
        });
        
		function geodir_setsearch($form) {
			if ((dist > 0 || (jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]', $form).val() == 'nearest' || jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]', $form).val() == 'farthest')) && (jQuery(".snear", $form).val() == '' || jQuery(".snear", $form).val() == 'Near')) jQuery(".snear", $form).val(default_location);
			geocodeAddress($form);
		}

        function updateSearchPosition(latLng, $form) {
            if (window.gdMaps === 'google') {
                jQuery('.sgeo_lat').val(latLng.lat());
                jQuery('.sgeo_lon').val(latLng.lng());
            } else if (window.gdMaps === 'osm') {
                jQuery('.sgeo_lat').val(latLng.lat);
                jQuery('.sgeo_lon').val(latLng.lon);
            }
            jQuery($form).submit(); // submit form after insering the lat long positions
        }

        function geocodeAddress($form) {
            // Call the geocode function
            Sgeocoder = window.gdMaps == 'google' ? new google.maps.Geocoder() : null;

            if (jQuery('.snear', $form).val() == '' || ( jQuery('.sgeo_lat').val() != '' && jQuery('.sgeo_lon').val() != ''  ) || jQuery('.snear', $form).val().match("^In:")) {
                if (jQuery('.snear', $form).val().match("^In:")) {
                    jQuery(".snear", $form).val('');
                }
                jQuery($form).submit();
            } else {
                var address = jQuery(".snear", $form).val();

                if (jQuery('.snear', $form).val() == 'Near') {
                    initialise2();
                } else {
                                        if (window.gdMaps === 'google') {
                        Sgeocoder.geocode({'address': address},
                            function (results, status) {
                                if (status == google.maps.GeocoderStatus.OK) {
                                    updateSearchPosition(results[0].geometry.location, $form);
                                } else {
                                    alert("Search was not successful for the following reason :" + status);
                                }
                            });
                    } else if (window.gdMaps === 'osm') {
                        geocodePositionOSM(false, address, false, false, 
                            function(geo) {
                                if (typeof geo !== 'undefined' && geo.lat && geo.lon) {
                                    updateSearchPosition(geo, $form);
                                } else {
                                    alert("Search was not successful for the requested address.");
                                }
                            });
                    } else {
                        jQuery($form).submit();
                    }
                }
            }
        }

        function initialise2() {
            if (!window.gdMaps) {
                return;
            }
            
            if (window.gdMaps === 'google') {
                var latlng = new google.maps.LatLng(56.494343, -4.205446);
                var myOptions = {
                    zoom: 4,
                    mapTypeId: google.maps.MapTypeId.TERRAIN,
                    disableDefaultUI: true
                }
            } else if (window.gdMaps === 'osm') {
                var latlng = new L.LatLng(56.494343, -4.205446);
                var myOptions = {
                    zoom: 4,
                    mapTypeId: 'TERRAIN',
                    disableDefaultUI: true
                }
            }
            try { prepareGeolocation(); } catch (e) {}
            doGeolocation();
        }

        function doGeolocation() {
            if (navigator.geolocation) {
                navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(positionSuccess, positionError);
            } else {
                positionError(-1);
            }
        }

        function positionError(err) {
            var msg;
            switch (err.code) {
                case err.UNKNOWN_ERROR:
                    msg = "Unable to find your location";
                    break;
                case err.PERMISSION_DENINED:
                    msg = "Permission denied in finding your location";
                    break;
                case err.POSITION_UNAVAILABLE:
                    msg = "Your location is currently unknown";
                    break;
                case err.BREAK:
                    msg = "Attempt to find location took too long";
                    break;
                default:
                    msg = "Location detection not supported in browser";
            }
            jQuery('#info').html(msg);
        }

        function positionSuccess(position) {
            var coords = position.coords || position.coordinate || position;
            jQuery('.sgeo_lat').val(coords.latitude);
            jQuery('.sgeo_lon').val(coords.longitude);

            jQuery('.geodir-listing-search').submit();
        }

        /**
         * On unload page do some cleaning so back button cache does not store these values.
         */
        window.onunload = function(){
            if(jQuery('.sgeo_lat').length ){
                jQuery('.sgeo_lat').val('');
                jQuery('.sgeo_lon').val('');
            }
        };

    </script>

<script type="text/javascript">
        jQuery(document).ready(function () {
            jQuery('.geodir-bestof-cat-list a, #geodir_bestof_tab_dd').on("click change", function (e) {
                var widgetBox = jQuery(this).closest('.geodir_bestof_widget');
                var loading = jQuery(widgetBox).find("#geodir-bestof-loading");
                var container = jQuery(widgetBox).find('#geodir-bestof-places');

                jQuery(document).ajaxStart(function () {
                    //container.hide(); // Not working when more then one widget on page
                    //loading.show();
                }).ajaxStop(function () {
                    loading.hide();
                    container.fadeIn('slow');
                });

                e.preventDefault();

                var activeTab = jQuery(this).closest('dl').find('dd.geodir-tab-active');
                activeTab.removeClass('geodir-tab-active');
                jQuery(this).parent().addClass('geodir-tab-active');

                var term_id = 0;
                if (e.type === "change") {
                    term_id = jQuery(this).val();
                } else if (e.type === "click") {
                    term_id = jQuery(this).attr('data-termid');
                }

                var post_type = jQuery(widgetBox).find('#bestof_widget_post_type').val();
                var excerpt_type = jQuery(widgetBox).find('#bestof_widget_excerpt_type').val();
                var post_limit = jQuery(widgetBox).find('#bestof_widget_post_limit').val();
                var taxonomy = jQuery(widgetBox).find('#bestof_widget_taxonomy').val();
                var char_count = jQuery(widgetBox).find('#bestof_widget_char_count').val();
                var add_location_filter = jQuery(widgetBox).find('#bestof_widget_location_filter').val();

                var data = {
                    'action': 'geodir_bestof',
                    'geodir_bestof_nonce': '5036667589',
                    'post_type': post_type,
                    'excerpt_type': excerpt_type,
                    'post_limit': post_limit,
                    'taxonomy': taxonomy,
                    'geodir_ajax': true,
                    'term_id': term_id,
                    'char_count': char_count,
                    'add_location_filter': add_location_filter
                };

                container.hide();
                loading.show();

                jQuery.post(geodir_var.geodir_ajax_url, data, function (response) {
                    container.html(response);
                    jQuery(widgetBox).find('.geodir_category_list_view li .geodir-post-img .geodir_thumbnail img').css('display', 'block');

                    // start lazy load if it's turned on
                    if(geodir_var.geodir_lazy_load==1){
                        geodir_init_lazy_load();
                    }

                });
            })
        });
        jQuery(document).ready(function () {
            if (jQuery(window).width() < 660) {
                if (jQuery('.bestof-widget-tab-layout').hasClass('bestof-tabs-on-left')) {
                    jQuery('.bestof-widget-tab-layout').removeClass('bestof-tabs-on-left').addClass('bestof-tabs-as-dropdown');
                } else if (jQuery('.bestof-widget-tab-layout').hasClass('bestof-tabs-on-top')) {
                    jQuery('.bestof-widget-tab-layout').removeClass('bestof-tabs-on-top').addClass('bestof-tabs-as-dropdown');
                }
            }
        });
    </script>

                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4732);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5433);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4948);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://www.maysville-online.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){

                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */

                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){

                });

            }

            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Repairs to a 14-inch water line leading from the city of Maysville's reservoir on Edgemont Road are complete and water service should be restored to the valley area of the city within the hour, according to officials with the Maysville Utility Commission.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/maysville-online.com/news" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Customers are advised to open the faucet in the highest point of the building first to allow the release of air in the lines.   A boil water advisory is also in effect until Sunday morning.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/maysville-online.com/news" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>

<div class="subscriber-only"><p>The break caused all water service to the valley area of the city to be shut off early Friday morning.  The area affected extends from Pasquales restaurant on U.S. 68 to the east on Kentucky 10 past Valley View subdivision to the west on Kentucky 8 in Plugtown. </p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Residents may call the Maysville Utility Commission office at 564-3531 with questions or concerns. </p>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">

</div>

<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://www.maysville-online.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=050cd342-6482-11e1-bd03-0019bb2963f4&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != '050cd342-6482-11e1-bd03-0019bb2963f4') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://www.maysville-online.com/tncms/block/1467542/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

Boil Water Notice Lifted: Etoile Water Supply customers in Lake Crest Manor

ETOILE, TX (KTRE) – A boil water notice has been lifted for customers of Etoile Water Supply PWS ID 1740011. 

According to a news release from EWS, the water is safe for consumption and it is no longer necessary to boil the water.

The original notice was made as required by the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) when a line break was discovered.

The line has been repaired and the boil water notice has been canceled, effective immediately. 

If you have questions about this contact Charlie Luse at 936-854-2215.

    On the morning of Dec. 4, 1974, the body of Dr. Donald Ripley was found in his chiropractic office at 1825 W. Main St. He was lying face down in a hallway leading from his office to a reception room. It was later determined that Ripley had been shot seven times with a .45. Slugs were found in a wall of the office. Investigators immediately began a door-to-door check of the homes in the residential area around Ripley's office, but no one heard any shots or saw anything unusual that morning, according to reports. Sheriff Russell Oxford said a resident saw Ripley arrive at his office shortly after 7 a.m. in a camper truck that he drove, and Ripley was known to have taken one of his sons to school at 8:05 a.m.

    Boil order for part of Boone County

    by Jennifer Weiser

    Fri, 02 Mar 2012 04:50:00 GMT — 


    A water main break is forcing a boil order for part of Boone County. The order affects the Public Water Supply District No. 10 of Boone County. That area is southeast and southwest of Centralia. It includes the area south of Swiney Lane and from Adams Road, east to Route Z. The area south of Highway 22 (east of Centralia), west to Route Z is also affected.





    The boil order is until noon Tuesday, March 6th.




    The water district reminds people affected to remember to turn off their ice makers.

        googletag.cmd = googletag.cmd || [],

        var getPreBidVarValue = function() {
            var constructedVar;
            var urlPathReg = /([^\/]*)\/*$/;
            var classifiedSearchReg = /homes|cars|jobs|search/;
            var urlPath = window.location.pathname;
            var lastUrlComponent = urlPath.match(urlPathReg)[1];
            var marketIdentifier = mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.market_identifier');
            var pageLevel = mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.pagelevel');
            var sourceLevel = mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.sourcelevel');
            var isArticle = new RegExp(/.html$/).test(urlPath);
            if ( lastUrlComponent === 'video' ) {
                pageLevel = 'videofront';
            } else if ( lastUrlComponent === 'galleries' ) {
                pageLevel = 'galleryfront';
            } else if ( lastUrlComponent.match(classifiedSearchReg) ) {
                pageLevel = pageLevel + '.' + sourceLevel;
            } else if (urlPath.search("/weather/") !== -1  && !isArticle) {
                pageLevel = 'sectfront.weather';
            } else if (urlPath.search("/latest-news/") !== -1 && !isArticle) {
                pageLevel = 'sectfront.latestnews';
            } else if (urlPath.search("-columns-blogs/") !== -1 && !isArticle) {
                pageLevel = 'blogfront';
            }

            if ( mi_Ads.env.outOfMarket.pageLevelOOM === true && mi_Ads.env.outOfMarket.serverOOMHeader === true ) {
                pageLevel = pageLevel + '-oom';
            }

            constructedVar = marketIdentifier + '.' + pageLevel;

            return constructedVar;
        };
        var preBidMarketPage = getPreBidVarValue();
    </script>

<p class="published-date">
<span id="pubilsh_date">
                        March 01, 2012 05:00 AM
                    </span>
</p>
<p class="published-date">
<span id="update_date">
                            UPDATED March 01, 2012 09:26 AM
                        </span>

<div class="dateline-storybody">
<div class="clearfix" id="story-target">
<div class="content-body" id="content-body-">
<p>State health officials have rescinded an advisory that residents in the east-central Kansas town of Pleasanton boil water because of a water-main break.</p>
<p>The Kansas Department of Health and Environment issued an update Thursday two days after the water main break caused a loss of pressure in the town’s water system. Testing of water samples indicate no evidence of contamination, KDHE said.</p>
<p>Pleasanton is in Linn County about 25 miles north of Fort Scott.</p>

<div class="fb-comments in" data-href="" data-numposts="10" data-width="100%" id="fb-comments"></div>
<script>
(function(){
  var $commentingContainer = $('#commenting-container'),
      $commentContainerChevron = $commentingContainer.find(".glyphicon-chevron-down"),
      $fbComments = $("#fb-comments");
      
    if($("meta[property='fb:app_id']").length === 1 && $("meta[name='allow-comments']").prop("content") === "true") {
         
      $commentingContainer.on('click', 'a.comments-toggle', function(){
        if (typeof mi.commenting === "undefined") {
            mi.commenting = new mi.Commenting();
            mi.commenting.setConf( {
                accountName: mi.pageInfo.getConf('marketInfo.domain'),
                fbapp_id: mi.pageInfo.getConf('facebook.app.id'),
                fb_comment_div: {'data-width': '100%'}
            });
            mi.commenting.display();
            FB.XFBML.parse(document.getElementById("fb-comments"));
        }
        
        toggleComments();
      });
      
      $(document).ready(function(){
        toggleComments();
      });
      
    } else {
      
        var disabledText = 'Comments have been disabled for this story.';
        $fbComments.prepend("<p><strong>" + disabledText + "</strong></p>");
        
    }
    
    //toggleClass() wasn't working in IE the first time if it has the class
    function toggleComments(){
      if ($fbComments.hasClass('in')) {
          $fbComments.removeClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.removeClass("rotate");
      }else {
          $fbComments.addClass('in');
          $commentContainerChevron.addClass("rotate");
      }
    }
})();
</script>

<h4 class="media-title">Spirit to add 1,000 jobs in Wichita</h4>
<p class="media-leadtext">Spirit AeroSystems plans to add more than 1,000 jobs over the two years, President and CEO Tom Gentile announced Wednesday. It also plans $1 billion in new capital investment at its Wichita site over five years, he said. Gentile said the company needs to grow and is out of room. ( Video by Bo Rader / The Wichita Eagle/Dec. 6, 2017)</p>
</li>

        post_to_nextbee: function (widget_id, href) {
            if (this.required_values_present(widget_id)) {
                var nextbee_url = ['https://' + this.nextbee_host, 'nextbeeapis',
                    this.nextbee_client, this.nextbee_campaign, 'Event'].join('/') +
                    '?email=' + encodeURIComponent(this.user_email) +
                    '&widget_config_id=' + widget_id;
                var timestamp_key = Math.floor(Date.now()).toString();
                var api_call_signature = md5(this.API_AUTHORIZATION_KEY +
                    this.ENCRYPTION_KEY + timestamp_key);

                console.log("NextBee URL: " + nextbee_url +
                    "\nAuth. Key: " + this.API_AUTHORIZATION_KEY +
                    "\nEnc. Key:  " + this.ENCRYPTION_KEY +
                    "\nTimestamp: " + timestamp_key +
                    "\nSignature: " + api_call_signature);

                $.ajax( { url: nextbee_url, type: 'post', headers: {
                    'ts-key': timestamp_key,
                    'api-call-signature': api_call_signature,
                    'cache-control': 'no-cache',
                    'content-type': 'application/json',
                    },
                    complete: function(data) {
                        if(href)
                        {
                            window.location.href = href;
                        }
                        console.log("NextBee API response: " + data.responseText);
                    }
                } );
            }
        }
    };

    $(function(){
        nextbee.initialize();
    });
</script>

<div class="card-container"><div class="card-image card-image-top">
<div class="media-preview-20f9d652-da26-11e7-96cc-435f06f033c2 media-preview article-asset" data-aspect="original"><figure class="photo layout-vertical">
<div class="image">
<a href="/news/bomb-threat-clears-local-wal-mart/article_20f9d652-da26-11e7-96cc-435f06f033c2.html">
<img alt="Bomb threat clears local Wal-Mart" class="img-responsive lazyload letterbox" data-src="https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/palestineherald.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/3/f1/3f1535fa-da26-11e7-9ade-3fef2691f2ff/5a274a7b993ad.image.jpg?resize=200%2C298" height="1756" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAQAAAC1HAwCAAAAC0lEQVR42mM8Uw8AAh0BTZud3BwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=" width="1179"/>

<div class="card-body">
<div class="card-headline">
<h3 class="">
<a href="/news/bomb-threat-clears-local-wal-mart/article_20f9d652-da26-11e7-96cc-435f06f033c2.html">
        

        
        Bomb threat clears local Wal-Mart</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>Palestine Police officers were called on Tuesday, when a bomb threat at Wal-Mart, a 24-hour business on South Loop 256, was called in shortly before 4 p.m. </p>

<div class="card-body">
<div class="card-headline">
<h3 class="">
<a href="/news/news-and-satire-from-the-editor-ppd-announces-new-policy/article_f2ab5f70-d63b-11e7-8a52-13bfa468f8c1.html">
        

        
        News, and satire, from the editor: PPD announces new policy on facial hair</a></h3>
</div>
<div class="card-lead">
<p>Palestine Police officers participated in “No Shave November,” donating money they would otherwise spend on shaving to educate the public about cancer prevention, as well as assist those battling cancer. Palestine Police raised more than $700 for the cause. </p>

<p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">Due to a line break at Bassett Creek, the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) has required our water system, City of Palestine, PWS ID 0010001, to notify customers of the need to boil their water prior to consumption.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">To ensure destruction of all harmful bacteria and other microbes, water for drinking, cooking, and making ice should be boiled and cooled prior to use. The water should be brought to a vigorous, rolling boil and then boiled for two minutes. In lieu of boiling, you may purchase bottled water or obtain water from some other suitable source.</p>

Instructions to discontinue boiling will be issued in the same manner as this notice.</p><p xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">If you have questions concerning this matter, you may contact Robert Sedgwick (903) 731-8494 or Paula Ellis (903) 731-8423.</p>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

Ocean Springs Public Works lifts Magnolia Bayou Estates boil water notice

Print Email
Susan Ruddiman, The Mississippi Press By Susan Ruddiman, The Mississippi Press The Mississippi Press
on February 27, 2012 at 9:00 AM, updated February 27, 2012 at 9:06 AM
comments

OCEAN SPRINGS, Mississippi - The boil water notice issued on Friday for Magnolia Bayou Estates has been lifted as of Monday morning, according to Ocean Springs Public Works Director Andre Kaufman.

The system has been tested and is now clear for drinking purposes, he said. A broken water main late last week required the water to be boiled. It is no longer necessary to boil water.

Call the Department of Public Works at 228-875-3955 between the hours of 6:30 a.m. and 3:30 p.m. for further information.

<a class="h6 gray-dark-link text-capitalize block-display air-xxs" href="https://patch.com/georgia/eastatlanta/politics">politics & government</a> <h1>
      UPDATED: Boil Water Advisory For East Atlanta, Kirkwood And Reynoldstown Areas    </h1>
<h2 class="h4">Customers in affected areas should boil water for 1 minute past a rolling boil before using it for cooking, drinking or brushing teeth.</h2> <div class="clearfix summary-additional">
<span class="h6">By <a href="https://patch.com/users/peralte-paul">Péralte Paul, <span class="text-neutral">Patch Staff</span> </a> | <time datetime="2012-02-26 15:11:39">Feb 26, 2012 3:11 pm ET</time> | Updated <time datetime="2012-02-27 14:09:44">Feb 27, 2012 2:09 pm ET</time><a class="edit-p soft-hide gray-subtle-link" href="https://my.patch.com/article/3567467/edit" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Moderate Content."><span class="separator"></span> <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-paragraph fa-xs"></span></a></span><div class="flag-fb-like-wrapper air-xs-t"><div class="fb-like" data-action="like" data-href="https://patch.com/georgia/eastatlanta/boil-water-advisory-for-east-atlanta-kirkwood-areas" data-layout="button_count" data-share="true"></div></div> </div>
</div>
</section> <!-- /.block -->
</div>
</header> <!-- /#page-header -->
<div class="row">
<section class="col-md-8">
<a id="main-content"></a>
<div class="region region-content">
<section class="block block-system clearfix" id="block-system-main">
<div class="article-page-default not-posted-today">
<section id="beginning-of-article"></section>

visible-xs-inline-block" data-disqus-identifier="3567467">0</span></a></div></div>
<div class="content-main-image">
<img alt="UPDATED: Boil Water Advisory For East Atlanta, Kirkwood And Reynoldstown Areas" class="img-responsive center-block" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/78086/2012/02/T800x600/7385066c0768d5297e86d7fb59f3b947.jpg"/> </div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p><strong>UPDATE: City officials have lifted the water advisory.</strong></p>A Georgia Power outage resulted in a temporary loss of pressure in the drinking water system. The system was restored to normal operations within approximately 30 minutes. <p>However, in an abundance of caution, a boil-water advisory is in effect for the following areas:</p> <ul> <li><strong>Flat Shoals to Haas Ave to the east, Glenwood Ave to the south, Moreland to the west, and McPherson to the north.</strong></li> <li><strong>Holtzclaw Road from Stovall to the east, Kirkwood to the north, Chester to the west, and Memorial to the south.</strong></li> <li><strong>Hosea L. Williams Drive that area could be bounded by 4th Ave to the east, Cottage Grove to the south, Lakeview to the west, and Gordon Road to the north.</strong></li> </ul> <p>To be cautious, customers in those areas should boil water for 1 minute past a rolling boil before using it for cooking, drinking or brushing teeth. Infants, the elderly and those with immune deficiencies should be particularly careful.</p> <p>The Department of Watershed Management is flushing the system as a precaution and sampling the affected zones to affirm that there is no contamination in the system, as well as investigating causes of the power interruption.</p> <p>The advisory is in effect until further notice.</p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">   Subscribe  <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>

Medina water main break closes schools

Print Email
Michael Sangiacomo, The Plain Dealer By Michael Sangiacomo, The Plain Dealer cleveland.com
Email the author | Follow on Twitter
on March 09, 2012 at 7:37 AM, updated March 09, 2012 at 7:44 PM
comments

Updated 3-9-12 at 7:35 p.m.

MEDINA, Ohio -- A massive water main break this morning has affected much of the city, including the closing of city schools and the recreation center and the issuance of a water boil alert.

The break, reported at 5:30 a.m. on Forest Meadows Drive, affects large portions of the south and east sides of the city.

The Medina Water Department was able to repair the break by Friday evening.

The city says that anyone who has little or no water pressure must boil water used for drinking or cooking until further notice. The boil alert is expected to be lifted sometime Saturday morning.

Medina City Schools and the Medina City Recreation Center (MCRC) have announced they are closed today.

Residents can tune to cable channel 37 and the city of Medina website for more  details.

width:30%;height:60px;overflow:hidden;min-width:320px"><iframe allowtransparency="true" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" src="//www.facebook.com/plugins/like.php?href=http://mauinow.com/2012/03/08/boil-water-advisory-issued-for-central-and-south-maui/&layout=standard&show_faces=false&width=300&action=recommend&colorscheme=light" style="border:none"></iframe></div><!-- Font Sizing --><ul id="fontsizes" style="float:right"><span>Text Size:</span><li class="regular focus" rel="fontregular">A</li><li class="medium" rel="fontmedium">A</li><li class="large" rel="fontlarge">A</li></ul><!-- End Font Sizing --></div><div style="clear:both"></div><!-- ARTICLE CONTENT --><center><div id="article_image_expand"><a class="close" href="#">×</a><div class="image_holder"><div class="image"></div></div></div><!--<div class="defer-loader"><img src="http://mauinow.com/wp-content/themes/pagespeed/library/images/loader.svg"></div>--><div class="article_content"> <p></p><div class="wp-caption alignleft" id="attachment_59268" style="max-width: 310px"><a href="http://mauinow.com/files/2012/03/brown-water-maui.jpg"><img alt="" class="size-medium wp-image-59268" height="168" src="//mauinow.com/files/2012/03/brown-water-maui-300x168.jpg" title="brown water maui" width="300"/></a><p class="wp-caption-text">Photo of 'Iao on Maui on Thursday afternoon 3/8/12. Photo by Wendy Osher.</p></div><p>By Wendy Osher</p><p>(Update: 9:40 a.m. 3/10/12) BOIL WATER ADVISORY FOR SOUTH AND CENTRAL MAUI CANCELED. DEPARTMENT OF WATER SUPPLY REPORTS TEST RESULTS NEGATIVE. AGAIN, BOIL WATER ADVISORY FOR SOUTH AND CENTRAL MAUI CANCELED.</p><p>(Update: 1:14 p.m. 3/9/12)</p><p>Boil Water Advisory Continues: </p><div class="dfp-ad-spacer"><!-- /25189245/mn-sidebar-15 --><div id="div-gpt-ad-1508444657802-0" style="height:250px; width:300px"><script>googletag.cmd.push(function() { googletag.display('div-gpt-ad-1508444657802-0'); });</script></div></div> <p>The Department of Water Supply continues to advise customers in the Central and South Maui areas to boil water before consumption due to possible contamination from rainwater. Affected areas include Kahului, Wailuku, Paia, Spreckelsville, Waikapu, Puunene, Kihei, Wailea, Makena, and Maalaea.</p><p>County officials say that the DWS is concerned only about possible sediment from storm runoff, which got into the system. There has been no contamination from wastewater, according to County Communications Director Rod Antone.</p><p>“Although work crews believe they flushed the storm water out last night residents are asked to boil their water as a precaution,” said Antone. At this time, DWS authorities say there are no water quality violations; the advisory is a precautionary measure for public health and safety purposes. <!-- MOBILE TEXT ADS --></p><div class="mobile_text_ads"><div style="clear:both"></div><div class="textad_holder pmg_ad_holder_10_6_47 pmg_ad_holder_10_6_48" style="padding-top:5px;border-top:1px solid #999;border-bottom:1px solid #999;background-color:#fff;padding-bottom:5px;padding-left:10px;position:relative;left:-5px;margin-bottom:6px"><center>ADVERTISEMENT<div style="clear:both;margin-bottom:5px"></div><!-- START ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : MOBILE TEXT MID ARTICLE 1 --><script type="text/javascript">ad_queue.push("10||6||47");</script><div id="adserver_10_6_47" style="width:46%;float:left"></div><!-- END ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : MOBILE TEXT MID ARTICLE 1 --><!-- START ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : MOBILE TEXT MID ARTICLE 2 --><script type="text/javascript">ad_queue.push("10||6||48");</script><div id="adserver_10_6_48" style="width:46%;float:left;margin-left:10px"></div><!-- END ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : MOBILE TEXT MID ARTICLE 2 --></center><div style="clear:both"></div></div></div> <!-- DESKTOP MID-ARTICLE TEXT AD --><div class="desktop_text_ads"><div style="clear:both"></div><script type="text/javascript">ad_queue.push("10||6||72");</script><div id="adserver_10_6_72"></div><div style="clear:both"></div></div><!-- END DESKTOP MID-ARTICLE TEXT AD --> <script type="text/javascript">var mobile_text_ad_hide = function(){	if(jQuery(window).width() > 600)	{	jQuery(".mobile_text_ads").hide();	}	};	jquery_queue.push("mobile_text_ad_hide();");</script><!-- END MOBILE TEXT ADS--> <p>Customers should bring water to a rapid boil for three minutes or more prior to consumption or use, or use bottled water.</p><p>DWS personnel are out in the water system flushing waterlines to ensure clean water. Laboratory personnel will take samples to verify water quality tomorrow. Another update will be provided once samples show no contamination.</p><p>(Update: 9:03 p.m. 3/8/12)</p><p>The Maui Department of Water Supply is recommending that customers in the Central and South Maui areas boil water before consumption due to possible contamination from flooding.</p><p>Affected areas include Kahului, Wailuku, Paia, Spreckelsville, Waihee, Waikapu, Puunene, Kihei, Wailea, Makena, and Maalaea.</p><p>“At this time, there are no water quality violations; the advisory is a precautionary measure for public health and safety purposes,” said DWS Administrative Officer, Jacky Takakura in a statement issued Thursday night.</p><p>Customers should boil water at a rapid boil for three minutes or more prior to consumption or use, or use bottled water.</p><p>DWS personnel are out in the water system flushing waterlines to ensure clean water and laboratory personnel will take samples to verify water quality tomorrow.</p><p>An update will be issued once samples show no contamination.</p><p>Customers are asked to call the DWS service line (270-7633) only if a water emergency occurs.</p><p>(Posted: 5:23 p.m. 3/8/12)</p><p>DWS Flushing “Dirty Water” at Kehalani: Water officials on Maui have confirmed that there have been reports of ‘dirty water’ in the Kehalani area in Wailuku. Crews are there now flushing the hydrants. The water supervisor expects the water to clear up in about an hour, according to DWS Administrative Officer, Jacky Takakura.  DWS has not found any waterline breaks in the area. Takakura says there is a chlorine residual in the water so it should still be safe.</p><p>5:23 p.m. 3/8/12: DWS Flushing “Dirty Water” at Kehalani: Water officials on Maui have confirmed that there have been reports of ‘dirty water’ in the Kehalani area in Wailuku. Crews are there now flushing the hydrants. The water supervisor expects the water to clear up in about an hour, according to DWS Administrative Officer, Jacky Takakura. DWS has not found any waterline breaks in the area. Takakura says there is a chlorine residual in the water so it should still be safe. </p></div></center> <!-- END ARTICLE CONTENT --> </article><!-- LOGO TILE ADS --><center><div class="logotile_holder pmg_ad_holder_10_6_24 pmg_ad_holder_10_6_25 pmg_ad_holder_10_6_26" style="max-width:340px"><center><small style="font-size:11px;font-weight:normal;color:#333">ADVERTISEMENT</small><br/><!-- START ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : SMALL LOGO TILE 1 --><script type="text/javascript">ad_queue.push("10||6||24||0||0||100");</script><div class="logotile" id="adserver_10_6_24"></div><!-- END ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : SMALL LOGO TILE 1 --><!-- START ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : SMALL LOGO TILE 2 --><script type="text/javascript">ad_queue.push("10||6||25||0||0||100");</script><div class="logotile" id="adserver_10_6_25"></div><!-- END ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : SMALL LOGO TILE 2 --><!-- START ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : SMALL LOGO TILE 3 --><script type="text/javascript">ad_queue.push("10||6||26||0||0||100");</script><div class="logotile" id="adserver_10_6_26"></div><!-- END ADVERTISEMENT : MAUI NOW : SMALL LOGO TILE 3 --></center></div></center><!-- END LOGO TILE ADS --><p><a href="?print" target="_blank">Print</a></p><p></p><div class="widget" style="text-align:left"><h1>Share this Article</h1> <!-- AddThis Share Buttons --><!-- Go to www.addthis.com/dashboard to customize your tools --><div class="addthis_sharing_toolbox"></div><script type="text/javascript">var giftofspeed = document.createElement('script');	giftofspeed.type = 'text/javascript';	giftofspeed.src = '//s7.addthis.com/js/300/addthis_widget.js#pubid=ra-5011a98a2d7348d1';	var godefer = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];	godefer.parentNode.insertBefore(giftofspeed, godefer);</script><!-- End AddThis Share Buttons --><div style="clear:both"></div></div><div class="dfp-ad-spacer"><!-- /25189245/mn-sidebar-18 --><div id="div-gpt-ad-1508444657802-3" style="height:250px; <div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<style>#ndn-video-player-1.ndn_embedded .ndn_floatContainer { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; }</style>
<div class="ndn-container p402_hide">
<div class="ndn_embed" data-config-distributor-id="90319" data-config-height="9/16w" data-config-width="100%" id="ndn-video-player-1"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">var _ndnq = _ndnq || []; _ndnq.push(['embed']);</script>

<style>#ndn-video-player-2.ndn_embedded .ndn_floatContainer { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 20px; }</style>
<div class="ndn-container p402_hide">
<div class="ndn_embed" data-config-distributor-id="90319" data-config-height="9/16w" data-config-width="100%" id="ndn-video-player-2"></div>
<script type="text/javascript">var _ndnq = _ndnq || []; _ndnq.push(['embed']);</script>
</div>
<p>For the second time this week, West Virginia American Water has issued a precautionary boil water advisory for about 300 customers in the communities of Bim, Pondco, Barrett, Wharton and Clinton in Boone County.The affected area includes W.Va. 85 beginning in Bim and running through Clinton, as well as all side roads in between. The advisory follows a water main break, which drained a nearby water storage tank, according to West Virginia American Water.In the original boil-water advisory, issued Monday afternoon, the company said a power outage to a booster station caused a water storage tank to drain. That initial advisory was lifted late Tuesday afternoon.The Department of Health and Human Resources has lifted a boil-water advisory for the Lively area of the Pax Water Company in Fayette County.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-608361">
