        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

    On the morning of Dec. 4, 1974, the body of Dr. Donald Ripley was found in his chiropractic office at 1825 W. Main St. He was lying face down in a hallway leading from his office to a reception room. It was later determined that Ripley had been shot seven times with a .45. Slugs were found in a wall of the office. Investigators immediately began a door-to-door check of the homes in the residential area around Ripley's office, but no one heard any shots or saw anything unusual that morning, according to reports. Sheriff Russell Oxford said a resident saw Ripley arrive at his office shortly after 7 a.m. in a camper truck that he drove, and Ripley was known to have taken one of his sons to school at 8:05 a.m.

Boil advisory issued in Beaver Meadows


Published: March 7, 2012

Article Tools

Font size
– +
Share This
   

A water boil advisory has been issued in Beaver Meadows due to a water main break that occurred in the borough Wednesday afternoon.

According to a notice delivered to residents by the Beaver Meadows Water Division, crews shut off water to the borough and were working Wednesday night to restore service. Water was expected to be shut off for two to four hours, according to the notice.

When service is restored, residents should boil water for at least one minute before consumption or use in preparing food. Water could be discolored, so officials advise against washing clothes in water from system.

Samples will be collected and tested to determine when the boil advisory can be lifted. Representatives of the water division will hand-deliver notices at that time.

City of Sundown Under Boil Water Notice

Cole Shooter
March 7, 2012
  • Share on Twitter
  • Share on Facebook

The City of Sundown is under a boil water notice.

The Texas Commission on Environmental Quality is requiring all customers of the City of Sundown water system to boil their water prior to consumption.

The boil water notice is due to unspecified conditions recently in their water system, which could include breaks in water mains.

The State recommends that all water to be used for drinking, cooking, and ice making should be boiled for two minutes, or use bottled water.

The boil water notice is in effect until further notice.

Boil water notice for Ivanhoe Land of Lakes

Scott Mitchell , KBMT 7:35 AM. CST March 06, 2012
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST

BOIL WATER NOTIFICATION ISSUED FOR:

Ivanhoe Land of Lakes

DATE: 6 Mar 12

EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY, the District is issuing a BOIL WATER NOTICE per Texas Commission on Environmental Quality rules.

"To ensure destruction of all harmful bacteria and other microbes, water for drinking, cooking, and ice making should be boiled and cooled prior to consumption. The water should be brought to a vigorous rolling boil and then boiled for two minutes. In lieu of boiling, you may purchase bottled water or obtain water from some other suitable source. When it is no longer required to boil the water, water system officials will notify you."

The BOIL WATER NOTICE was due to water main repairs

Please follow the guidelines above until we have collected a sample of the water and had it tested by a TCEQ certified laboratory. The laboratory tests take at least 24 hours to complete once they have been delivered to the laboratory.

If you have any questions regarding this matter please contact: David Yohe at (512) 219-2272 or David Ortiz at (832) 209-5080.

<section class="block block-fe-components clearfix" id="block-fe-components-fe-components-header-block">
<div class="clearfix" id="header-block">
<a class="h6 gray-dark-link text-capitalize block-display air-xxs" href="https://patch.com/new-jersey/fortlee/around-town">community corner</a> <h1>
      How Were You Affected By the Water Main Break in Fort Lee?    </h1>
<h2 class="h4">United Water lifted its boil water advisory Saturday; we want to know how the company did responding to the incident and in its aftermath.</h2> <div class="clearfix summary-additional">
<span class="h6">By <a href="https://patch.com/users/norcrosseditor36979">Norcross Editor, <span class="text-neutral">Patch Staff</span> </a> | <time datetime="2012-03-05 17:23:13">Mar 5, 2012 5:23 pm ET</time> | Updated <time datetime="2012-03-06 12:49:49">Mar 6, 2012 12:49 pm ET</time><a class="edit-p soft-hide gray-subtle-link" href="https://my.patch.com/article/3633949/edit" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Moderate Content."><span class="separator"></span> <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-paragraph fa-xs"></span></a></span><div class="flag-fb-like-wrapper air-xs-t"><div class="fb-like" data-action="like" data-href="https://patch.com/new-jersey/fortlee/how-were-you-affected-by-the-water-main-break-in-fort-lee" data-layout="button_count" data-share="true"></div></div> </div>
</div>
</section> <!-- /.block -->
</div>
</header> <!-- /#page-header -->
<div class="row">
<section class="col-md-8">
<a id="main-content"></a>
<div class="region region-content">
<section class="block block-system clearfix" id="block-system-main">
<div class="article-page-default not-posted-today">
<section id="beginning-of-article"></section>
<div class="social-share-wrapper"><div class="social-share text-center"><a alt="Share on Facebook" category="social" class="social-btn social-btn-facebook" href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A//patch.com/new-jersey/fortlee/how-were-you-affected-by-the-water-main-break-in-fort-lee" target="_blank" title="Share on Facebook" target="_blank" title="Post on Google+" trigger="google_plus"><span class="fab fa-2x fa-google-plus-g"></span></a><a alt="Post on Reddit" category="social" class="social-btn social-btn-reddit hidden-xxs" href="http://www.reddit.com/submit?url=https%3A//patch.com/new-jersey/fortlee/how-were-you-affected-by-the-water-main-break-in-fort-lee&title=How%20Were%20You%20Affected%20By%20the%20Water%20Main%20Break%20in%20Fort%20Lee%3F" href="mailto:?subject=How%20Were%20You%20Affected%20By%20the%20Water%20Main%20Break%20in%20Fort%20Lee%3F&body=How%20Were%20You%20Affected%20By%20the%20Water%20Main%20Break%20in%20Fort%20Lee%3F%0D%0A%0D%0AUnited%20Water%20lifted%20its%20boil%20water%20advisory%20Saturday%3B%20we%20want%20to%20know%20how%20the%20company%20did%20responding%20to%20the%20incident%20and%20in%20its%20aftermath.%0D%0A%0D%0Ahttps://patch.com/new-jersey/fortlee/how-were-you-affected-by-the-water-main-break-in-fort-lee" title="Send Email" trigger="email"><span class="fa fa-2x fa-envelope"></span></a><a class="btn-comment-now social-btn social-btn-comments" href="#comments" title="View Comments for “How Were You Affected By the Water Main Break in Fort Lee?”"><span class="fa fa-2x fa-comments"></span><span class="disqus-comment-count p bold visible-lg-block visible-md-block visible-sm-block visible-xs-inline-block" data-disqus-identifier="3633949">0</span></a></div></div>
<div class="content-main-image">
<img alt="How Were You Affected By the Water Main Break in Fort Lee?" class="img-responsive center-block" src="https://cdn.patchcdn.com/users/36979/2012/03/T800x600/5dc6067d9487d4de7e5e767565c2b050.jpg"/> </div>
<div class="content-body center-block" id="article-wrapper">
<p>United Water announced Saturday morning that the <a href="https://patch.com/A-rpSH" rel="nofollow">boil water advisory it issued Thursday</a> for customers in parts of Fort Lee and Cliffside Park had been lifted.</p> <p>The advisory went into effect the day after <a href="https://patch.com/A-rnTn" rel="nofollow">a large water main break at Palisade Avenue and Bluff Road</a> Wednesday evening left large swaths of borough with little or no water pressure for several hours, and residents in the immediate vicinity of the break for much longer.</p> <p>The New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection (NJDEP) verified lab tests and confirmed that water met "all regulatory requirements," the company said Saturday, reminding people to call United Water's customer service center at 1-800-422-5987 for more information.</p> <p>But one Fort Lee resident who lives near where the break occurred told Patch in an email that his home had sustained serious damage as a result of the break, and another resident expressed anger and frustration that United Water was not doing a good job of keeping affected customers updated with accurate information.</p> <p><b>Now we want to know what you think. Take our polls below, and tell us about your experience in the comments section. How were you affected by the water main break, and how was United Water's response, in your opinion?</b></p><div id="in-article-boxed-recirc"><div class="text-center air-md"><a category="subscribe" class="btn btn-lg btn-cta-alt pill sans in-article-subscribe l-bold" href="/" trigger="article_button_click">   Subscribe  <span aria-hidden="true" class="fal fa-angle-right fa-lg"></span></a></div></div> </div>
<section id="below-article-recirc"><h5 class="up-next-header">More from Fort Lee Patch</h5><h6 class="up-next-header-alt soft-hide">Up next on Fort Lee Patch</h6><div class="mini-slot col-xs-12">

Water boil advisory issued for Beech Mountain

From staff reports
Published: March 4, 2012

Article Tools
Font size: [A] [A] [A]
Our Social Networks
Facebook
Sign Up newsletter

Due to an issue with a booster pump, Total Environmental Solutions Inc. customers in Beech Mountain Lakes have been issued a precautionary water boil advisory.

During the advisory, boiled or bottled water should be used for drinking, brushing teeth, washing dishes and preparing food until further notice.

Water should be brought to a boil for one minute, then let cool before consuming. Anyone with special medical conditions, infants, or elderly in their homes are asked to contact their doctors for further advice.
